title: cmd/yacc: no error output on windows
body:
by **cmelliso**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
Run `go tool yacc prog.y` on any .y file with any kind of error.


What is the expected output?
Some sort of error message.


What do you see instead?
No output, but the program does fail (returns false (1)).  go is completely silent, it
never outputs any sort of message (though it does generate files), and successfully
compiles when the input is correct.


Which operating system are you using?
windows 7 (both normal windows command prompt and under cygwin's bash).

I successfully get error messages under Ubuntu, so the problem is only with Windows.


Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1.2 windows/386
